item.title: Beocord 9000: Restoration of the Peak Program Meter with SMD LEDs (III)
item.description:
This article, the third in a series about restoring a Beocord 9000’s peak program meters (PPM), focuses on installing and calibrating the rebuilt PPM. The initial step involved switching the original current limiting resistors with values suitable for modern SMD LEDs. These LEDs are more efficient and brighter, requiring significantly larger resistors to match the original brightness. Testing showed that 470 Ohm and 330 Ohm resistors for red and green LEDs, respectively, produced slightly brighter output compared to the original 180 Ohm and 120 Ohm resistors...

item.description:

item.title: Beocord 9000: Restoring the Peak Program Meters with SMD LEDs
item.description:

Since the technology behind these PPMs is similar to that of a 7-segment display, I realized that the segments in this unit were also susceptible to future breakage. item.title: Beocord 5000 (4715/4716): Calibrating Recording Current and Bias
item.description:
Pleased with the seemingly functional Beocord 5000 (4715/4716) tape mechanism, an initial test recording was conducted using a waveform generator. Playback revealed a 3 dB channel imbalance on the Peak Program Meter (PPM), indicating a calibration issue. This was unsurprising given the deck’s age and highlighted the fortunate performance of a previously rebuilt Beocord 5000 in a Beolab 6000 setup, which operated well without calibration. item.title: Beocord 5000 (4715/4716): Calibrating the Peak Program Meters (VU Meters)
item.description:
After reassembling and successfully testing a Beocord 5000 tape deck, I decided to calibrate its Peak Program Meters (PPMs) according to the service manual. Instead of directly inputting a 300 Hz signal into the Dolby B ICs as the manual suggested, I opted to feed a 25 mV, 300 Hz signal into the Beocord’s inputs while in record mode (paused). Using a multimeter, I adjusted the recording levels to achieve the specified 740 mV RMS output at the Dolby B ICs (pin 7), allowing for the calibration of the PPMs’ 0 dB level...

item.title: Beocord 9000: Restoration of the Peak Program Meter with SMD LEDs (II)
item.description:
The Beocord 9000’s rebuilt Peak Program Meters (PPM) display passed a 24-hour test, confirming its functionality. To reattach the red-green covers, I secured the display to ensure a tight seal, preventing light leakage. Using a soldering iron, I melted the plastic posts of the covers, replicating the original attachment method. During cleaning, the glue holding the light guide dissolved, indicating it was likely polyvinyl ester-based. I used ‘Aleene’s Original Tacky Glue’ as a substitute, providing a clear and durable bond...
